unit: Unit 4 | Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
title: Bank Loans
question_text:
A large corporation hopes to get a loan to build an addition to its current corporate headquarters.
From experience, the president of the company has determined an $8\%$ chance of getting approved for the loan from any given bank, so she sends out applications to $10$ different banks.
Assuming each bank considers the loan independently, what is the probability that at least one of the $10\text{ banks}$ selected grants the loan?
solution:
We know form the prompt that there is an $8\%$ chance of getting approved for the loan from any given bank, meaning there is a $92\%$ chance of not getting approved by any given bank.

To find the answer, we have to find the probability of at least one bank granting the loan among the $10$ different banks that are attempted. This give us the following:

$$\text{P(at least one)} = 1-\text{P(none)} $$

$$= 1-(0.92)^{10} $$

$$= 0.5656$$

Thus, the correct answer is Choice 'C'.
